segments.text: I see the water running over the edge of the sink, creating a mess on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's such a waste of water, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the woman standing in the puddle, oblivious to the water around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's just drying dishes, completely unaware of the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be really tired or just not paying attention.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so mischievous, taking cookies without permission.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy on the stool, reaching for the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He looks like he's about to fall, and it makes me cringe.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the girl waiting for her share, her arm raised towards the jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She looks so innocent, but she's still part of the mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the garden outside, so peaceful and tidy compared to the mess inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's such a contrast, and it makes me feel a bit uneasy.
segments.speaker: PAR
